snippet: If we are serious about uprooting corruption in Albany, the next step is to make service as a legislator a full-time job and ban outside sources of employment and income for our public officials.
abstract: Op-Ed article by former New York State insurance superintendent Eric R Dinallo posits that one of the reasons why New York State legislators have a dismal ethics record is that they are part-timers; contends that to curb criminal corruption in Albany, public officials should be banned from outside sources of employment and income.
lead_paragraph: If we are serious about uprooting corruption in Albany, the next step is to make service as a legislator a full-time job and ban outside sources of employment and income for our public officials.
